definition: to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
lit. a thief crying "Stop the thief!" (idiom)/fig. to accuse sb of a theft and try to sneak away oneself/to cover up one's misdeeds by shifting the blame onto others
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to whisper to one another's ear
to start the servers (for an online game, typically after the system has been shut down for maintenance, upgrade etc)
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
